description: A richly documented ultimate explorer's guide to more than 700 hidden marvels, events and curiosities around the world.
title: ATLAS OBSCURA
author: Joshua Foer, Dylan Thuras and Ella Morton

description: More photographs, this time accompanied by interviews, from the creator of the blog and the book “Humans of New York.”
title: HUMANS OF NEW YORK: STORIES
author: Brandon Stanton

description: An American expatriate travels around his adopted country, Britain.
title: THE ROAD TO LITTLE DRIBBLING
author: Bill Bryson

description: Four hundred color photos of New Yorkers, with brief commentary. Originally published in 2013.
title: HUMANS OF NEW YORK
author: Brandon Stanton

description: A memoir by the pilot who made an emergency landing on the Hudson River in 2009. Originally published as “Highest Duty” in 2009. The basis for the 2016 movie.
title: SULLY
author: Chesley B Sullenberger III with Jeffrey Zaslow

description: A photographic tour of 225 global destinations.
title: DESTINATIONS OF A LIFETIME
author: the staff of National Geographic

description: The creator of the New York Times dialect quiz provides a guide to how words are pronounced in different parts of the country.
title: SPEAKING AMERICAN
author: Josh Katz

description: An account of the life-changing 1,100-mile solo hike along the Pacific Crest Trail in 1995. Originally published in 2012 and a 2014 movie.
title: WILD
author: Cheryl Strayed

description: The author was lost on a train in India at age 5, then adopted by a couple in Australia; he searched for and found his birth family as an adult. Originally published in 2014 as “A Long Way Home” and the basis for the 2016 movie.
title: LION
author: Saroo Brierley

description: Essays and 26 imaginative maps celebrate New York City.
title: NONSTOP METROPOLIS
author: Rebecca Solnit and Joshua Jelly-Schapiro
